title: Why can Windwall Block Orrns Ult?
body:
Seems a little over the top to me. 
Oddly, it cant stop a Bard ult. 

maybe, one day, Riot will swallow the pill and admit that Yasuo is overtuned.

replies.body:
It blocks Taliyah's wall too.

A self-propelled giant wall of stone that comes up through the ground.
Find me one dictionary where that falls under the category of 'projectile'.

> [{quoted}](name=Lord Sesshomaru,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=rj9Xek7n,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2017-11-04T09:37:21.466+0000)
>
> It blocks Taliyah's wall too.
> 
> A self-propelled giant wall of stone that comes up through the ground.
> Find me one dictionary where that falls under the category of 'projectile'.

Challenge accepted!

[Merrian-Webster](https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/projectile):
A body [in this case, the "giant wall of stone"] projected by external force [in this case, Taliyah] and continuing in motion by its own inertia.

Or, if we're to consider the wall to be propelled by Taliyah the entire time, [The Free Dictionary](https://www.thefreedictionary.com/projectile) (referencing the American Heritage Dictionary of the English Language, fifth edition):
A fired, thrown, or otherwise propelled object [in this case, the "giant wall of stone"], such as a bullet, having no capacity for self-propulsion.

Or, if we're to consider "projectile" an adjective in this case (which I wouldn't, to be honest, but I like to cover my bases), [Oxford Dictionary](https://en.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/projectile):
Propelled with great force.

That said, I honestly don't think Taliyah's Weaver's Wall should be considered a projectile for the purposes of Yasuo's Wind Wall.

touchÃ©...

But luckily we all know Yasuo cant read.

> But with the way it's created, shouldn't windwall therefore stop Anivia, Jarvan etc. from making their walls?

If we're only considering dictionary definitions, then no, it shouldn't. Neither Anivia's nor Jarvin's walls could be considered projectiles, as neither of them actually travel any distance, nor are they "propelled" in any manner, they just "grow" from the ground. If we're considering balance, I'm going to refer to my earlier comment of:
>That said, I honestly don't think Taliyah's Weaver's Wall should be considered a projectile for the purposes of Yasuo's Wind Wall.
"Propel" is pushing something "forwards" though, this is technically pushed "up"!

Depends which definition you're using.

[Oxford Dictionary](https://en.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/propel) certainly uses the definition of "Drive or push something forwards", specifying a horizontal movement, however [Cambridge Dictionary](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/dictionary/english/propel) uses a less specific definition of "To push or move something somewhere, often with a lot of force", not specifying any direction, which would allow the inclusion of Taliyah's Weaver's Wall.

The fact is, there are a variety of dictionaries that use a variety of definitions for the same words, whether they be very similar or very different to those of Oxford and/or Cambridge. It's very difficult to say, definitively, which one is wholly accurate, but rather it comes down to each individual to choose for themselves which definitions they follow, which is a bit contradictory to the idea of language as it's supposed to allow clear and precise communication.
Yeah no, it's not a projectile by pure definition :)

i think i could understand if it was first cast of ult, when the ram is red and fiery, because the wind could blow the fire out (similar to how we blow candles) but the second cast makes no sense to me
Am gonna take a gues and say it is because of coding complication.
Yasuo windwall blocks azir soldiers theres no consistency riot just try to explain every bug as a feature

Yasuo's windwall can only block projectiles that come from infront of the windwall. e.g skill shots from ezreal and ranged auto attacks and ornn's ult, however he cannot block things that are from above or below, e.g bard ult and mf's raining bullet thing. Thats what i think

It certainly blocks Ornns ult, no matter the direction its coming. I've seen it done many times now. 
I think youre missing the point anyway, In what way is it acceptable that a basic ability like Windwall should have the power to completley stop dead a slow moving, telegraphed, ultimate ability in the form of a celestial God Ram. Why is it coded that way? Its stupid lol
Its just more on the stack of why I hate Yasuo so much.

I see your point, but it adds more strategy to the game. His w is on a 26-18 second cool down and lasts for 4 seconds. If you cant wait for Yasuo to block something less important such as Syndra W, then wait 4 seconds for it to be gone then don't play the game; Simple. And for anyone that claims Yasuo is broken, he is not. The fact that he needs specific stats to be useful (crit/attack speed) which can be easily countered by a Randuins Omen, ninja tabis and even some more armour if you want to completely cock block him makes him easily countered (or just ban him if you please).
